The best place to start looking for general resources on digital humanities is the [Digital Humanities Research Guide](https://guides.lib.vt.edu/dh).[^1]

The [Debates in the Digital Humanities series](https://dhdebates.gc.cuny.edu/) is the best place to get yourself situated in the field, see who is working in digital humanities, and what topics are of interest.

If you are looking to keep up with the latest developments in digital humanities, three great resources are [Reviews in Digital Humanities](https://reviewsindh.pubpub.org), [DH Now](https://digitalhumanitiesnow.org/) and [dh+lib](https://dhandlib.org). Scrolling through these resources will provide a great overview of recent activity.

The [Association for Computers and the Humanities](https://ach.org) (ACH) is the primary digital humanities association in the United States and is part of the worldwide [Alliance of Digital Humanities Organizations](https://adho.org) (ADHO).
